abstract: Kenneth D. Lewis spoke with the New York attorney general’s office about $3.6 billion in bonuses handed out to Merrill Lynch employees on the eve of its merger with the bank last year.
snippet: Kenneth D. Lewis spoke with the New York attorney general’s office about $3.6 billion in bonuses handed out to Merrill Lynch employees on the eve of its merger with the bank last year.
lead_paragraph: Kenneth D. Lewis, the chief executive of Bank of America, testified in a meeting with the New York attorney general’s office for four hours on Thursday about $3.6 billion in bonuses handed out to Merrill Lynch employees on the eve of its merger with the bank last year.

headline.main: Bank of America Chief Testifies on Bonuses

abstract: The New York attorney general’s office has subpoenaed Bank of America seeking the names of Merrill Lynch executives who received $3.6 billion in year-end bonuses, after Chief Executive Ken Lewis failed to provide those details during a lengthy deposition Thursday evening.
lead_paragraph: The New York attorney general’s office has subpoenaed Bank of America seeking the names of Merrill Lynch executives who received $3.6 billion in year-end bonuses, after Chief Executive Ken Lewis failed to provide those details during a lengthy deposition Thursday evening.

headline.main: Bank of America Is Subpoenaed as Chief Testifies on Bonuses

abstract: Three global development banks pledge aid in the form of equity and debt finance, credit lines and political risk insurance.
snippet: Three global development banks pledge aid in the form of equity and debt finance, credit lines and political risk insurance.
lead_paragraph: LONDON  With the former communist nations of Eastern and Central Europe reeling from the global economic crisis, three major lenders said on Friday that they would inject some 24.5 billion euros, or $31 billion, over two years into the region’s banks to try to rescue its businesses.

headline.main: Lenders Pledge $31 Billion for Eastern and Central Europe
headline.print_headline: Lenders Pledge $31 Billion for Eastern and Central Europe

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: European Bank for Reconstruction and Development
